toc_entry.title: The Soul Of East Texas
toc_entry.description: Reflections and recollections of life among the shadows of the Piney Woods.
toc_entry.byline: Photography by Keith Carter, Text by Prudence Mackintosh

toc_entry.title: Vigil At Treaty Oak
toc_entry.description: To the people of austin, the poisoning of an ancient tree was more than a crime; it was a blasphemy.

toc_entry.title: How Do You Say “Perestroika” In Spanish?
toc_entry.description: The parallels between Mikhail Gorbachev and Mexico’s Carlos Salinas just might end when it comes to their effectiveness at achieving reform in their nations.

toc_entry.title: Old Salts And Ancient Mariners
toc_entry.description: In which a landlubber chronicles the saga of getting his sea legs aboard the good ship Elissa.

toc_entry.title: The Day Leroy Died
toc_entry.description: When a small private bank was closed on august 7, depositors lost all of their money, a pillar of the community came tumbling down, and the town’s trusting way of life was shattered.

toc_entry.title: The Herkie Jump
toc_entry.subtitle: Texas Primer
toc_entry.description: Three cheers for Lawrence Herkimer and his leap to fame.

toc_entry.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
toc_entry.subtitle: Art
toc_entry.description: Two museum shows culled from private collections illustrate that Texans know what they like—and it’s not just Monets and Renoirs.

toc_entry.title: That Brainpower Guy
toc_entry.subtitle: Education
toc_entry.description: Incarnate Word was an obscure Catholic school before Lou agnese launched his multimillion-dollar ad campaign. Now the college is booming, and agnese is a local star.

toc_entry.title: Whistling In the Dark
toc_entry.subtitle: Books
toc_entry.description: Larry McMurtry explores the far side of forty in his new novel.

toc_entry.title: The Roar Of the Crowd
toc_entry.description: Ranking the rich; playing the game; watching the show.

toc_entry.title: Around the State
toc_entry.description: A selective guide to amusements and events.

toc_entry.title: Reporter
toc_entry.description: The animal Liberation Front terrorizes Texas Tech: RVs lumber through the Big Bend drug net; eclectic eats served to a boogie beat in the Hill Country.

toc_entry.title: State Secrets
toc_entry.description: Water, water, everywhere—in New Mexico, but Texas can’t have any; Mexico invades Texas; picking the winner in the race to succeed Mickey Leland.
